definition: clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears

sentences.english: At weekends, people can together with friends hold a small fashion show.
sentences.chinese: 在周末，人们可以与朋友一起举办一场小的服装秀。

sentences.english: We will have a creative costume show.
sentences.chinese: 我们将举行创意服装秀。

sentences.english: Have you prepared the fall winter wish list for a whole new wardrobe yet?Well, I have!
sentences.chinese: 开始为你的个人秋季服装秀准备好购买清单了吗？

sentences.english: The clothing designer had a fashion show.
sentences.chinese: 服装设计家开了一场服装秀。

sentences.english: What do you think of this fashion show?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得这场服装秀如何？

definition: a fashion show/to walk the runway (in a fashion show)
to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
